title: Frank Lampard celebrates wife Christine's birthday | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 24 shares His wife later posted an image of Lampard smiling at the table and said: 'Thank you for all your birthday wishes and your messages for @franklampard today. Really means a lot! We thought we'd have a celebratory dinner tonight.' The 38-year-old won every major club honour during his time at Stamford Bridge and also played for West Ham and Manchester City in the Premier League. Lampard posted a lengthy message thanking his family and those he played with and wrote: 'After 21 incredible years, I have decided that now is the right time to finish my career as a professional footballer. 'Whilst I have received a number of exciting offers to continue playing at home and abroad, at 38 I feel now is the time to begin the next chapter in my life. Lampard, pictured with Jose Mourinho and John Terry, won every major honour at Chelsea As well as three Premier League titles, he also won four FA Cups during his time at the club 'I’m immensely proud of the trophies I’ve won, of representing my country over 100 times and of scoring more than 300 career goals. 'I am forever grateful for the support of my family, my wife Christine and my two daughters Luna and Isla. What you have given me off the pitch has always been my strength on it. I love you all very much.' Lampard ended his time at Chelsea as the club's all-time record scorer with 211 goals, while also becoming the club's most internationally capped player and breaking the club's consecutive league appearance record thanks to his run of 164-straight games. In total he played 1010 professional matches, scoring exactly 300 goals for his clubs and at international level. RELATED ARTICLES
